name: Lebesgue measure
summary:
In measure theory, a branch of mathematics, the Lebesgue measure, named after French mathematician Henri Lebesgue, is the standard way of assigning a measure to subsets of higher dimensional Euclidean n-spaces. For lower dimensions 
  
    
      
        n
        =
        1
        ,
        2
        ,
        
          or 
        
        3
      
    
    {\displaystyle n=1,2,{\text{or }}3}
  
, it coincides with the standard measure of length, area, or volume. In general, it is also cal
